intro: Manulea parviflora var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered manulea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits containing one or two seeds. This species is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often with deep root systems to access underground water.
